p: Extraction solvents such as water [ 191, 192, 193], ethanol [ 185], ethanolâ€“water mixture [ 188, 189, 190], and even methanol [ 194] can be mixed with the plant material. The extract is obtained either by maceration [ 194], by heating or boiling for several minutes [ 184, 191] or hours [ 187, 195], or the mixture can be subjected to Soxhlet extraction [ 196]. However, it is recommended that high temperatures are avoided during heating, in order to prevent possible degradation of biomolecules that participate in the reduction process [ 197]. Most often, the mixture is further decanted or filtered through Whatman filter paper and stored in a cold place until further use.
